content.description: Let f and g be the functions given by f(x) = 2x(1 - x) and <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </math> for  <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>. The graphs of f and g are shown in the figure above.
content.question: Find the volume of the solid generated when the shaded region enclosed by the graphs of f and g is revolved above the horizontal line y = 2.

frqParts.text: Find the volume of the solid generated when the shaded region enclosed by the graphs of f and g is revolved above the horizontal line y = 2.

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
